qa.q: What is an InMemori page for?
qa.r:
With InMemori, you have access to a private page on which you can: 
- quickly inform your friends and family about the time and place of any planned funeral services,
- receive support messages, memories and photos from your loved ones on a dedicated space,
- organize a fundraiser in memory of your loved one, if you wish.

You can also order the book which gathers all the messages and pictures posted on your loved one’s InMemori page

qa.q: How can I create an InMemori page?
qa.r: Simply fill in the name, last name and date of death of your loved one as well as your email address, by clicking here. You only need 5 minutes to personalize the page and share it with those around you. Once the page is finalized, you will have access to your admin space, from which you can: - follow the activity of the page (number of views, number of tributes), - organize a fundraiser, if you wish, - order the book gathering all the shared tributes, - thank your loved ones.

qa.q: Who can create an InMemori page?
qa.r: Anyone can create a page. If you are a parent or a friend: it relieves families when someone around them helps them set up the service. If you are a colleague accompanying mourning in the workplace is an essential subject. By creating an InMemori page, you will allow everyone to find their place and express themselves. You only need to fill in the name, lastname and date of death of your loved one as well as your email address, by clicking here.

qa.q: How can I invite my closed ones to visit the page?
qa.r:
Very simple. Just share the page by sms and/or email, using the “Share page” function in your admin space if you are the administrator and/or at the bottom of the page if you have received its link.
You can also copy the link and paste it in any communication channel of your choice (social networks, WhatsApp, paper announcement...).

qa.q: Who can see the InMemori page?
qa.r:
Only people who received the page's link have access to it.
Every InMemori page is private: it will never appear in search engine results, like Google for example.

qa.q: Can I create an InMemori page if I do not have all the information yet?
qa.r:
Yes, only some information is essential.
To create an InMemori page, you only need to fill in the name and last name of your loved one and your email address. Once you have more information, you can go to your admin space to complete and share the page.

InMemori is a free service to allow everyone to have access.
Our goal is that every bereaved family can find help and support through an InMemori page.

qa.q: How do I manage an InMemori page?
qa.r:
If you are an administrator, you received a link by email and by SMS that redirects you to the admin space.
From this space, you can customize and complete the page:
- add a photo,
- customize the annoucement,
- inform or modify funeral information, 
- activate a fundraiser to support an association of your choice.
Once the page is finalized, you can invite your loved ones by sharing the page’s link through email or SMS.
You can also add other administrators and give them access to this admin space.

qa.q: What do I do if an inappropriate message or photo was posted?
qa.r: If you are an administrator of the page, you can delete a message or a photo from your admin space at any time in the section “Give thanks”.

qa.q: Can I delete an InMemori page?
qa.r:
If you are an administrator of the page, you can delete it at any time.
If you wish to delete the online version of the page but want to keep track of all the tributes shared by your loved ones you can order the InMemori book.

qa.q: What happens to an InMemori page over time?
qa.r:
There are two possibilities:
- you can keep the page online for as long as you want to allow all your loved ones to return and read the tributes,
- you can delete it at any time you choose.
The time of the mourning is personal, that is why this decision belongs to the administrators of the page.

qa.q: How can I find the InMemori page of a close one?
qa.r:
The intimacy of families is at the heart of InMemori's values, that's why all pages are private. Only people who receive the link of a page can access it. 
If you learn that an InMemori page has been created for a loved one, please contact the family or friends and ask for the page’s link.

qa.q: Can I post multiple photos on an InMemori page?
qa.r:
Yes, it’s very simple.
 You just have to click on the “Write a message” button and choose the “Photos” action. You can add as many photos as you like.
You can also attach multiple photos to the end of a message or memory to enrich your tribute.

qa.q: What is the difference between a condolence message and a memory?
qa.r:
A message of condolence is a testimony of support and participation in the pain of others.
A memory is a moment lived with the deceased person or something that illustrates their life.
These two types of messages are part of the tribute. The memories are very appreciated by the families because they bring softness and sometimes even a smile to the most affected people.
